lead_paragraph: The Countrywide Financial Corporation, the troubled lender that came to symbolize many of the excesses of the subprime mortgage crisis, is reportedly negotiating a sale to Bank of America, a move that would rescue Countrywide from an uncertain future.

headline.main: Bank of America in Talks to Buy Countrywide

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: As it watches its $2 billion investment in Countrywide Financial erode, the Bank of America faces a tough choice, says Fortune: It can buy Countrywide outright, pour even more money into the once high-flying mortgage lender, or simply bide its time and hope for the best.
